title: My device connected to E5377Bs-605’s wireless network, but cannot open Web UI
answer:
A:

1. Double ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924093433567001.jpg) to check your wireless network connection on windows start bar. Make sure your device is connected with your E5377Bs-605 not other Wi-Fi device.

2. Open Web Browser from your device (ex. Microsoft Internet Explorer). Go *<u>http://192.168.8.1</u>* to open E5377Bs-605’s Web UI.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924093434990002.jpg)

3. If Web Browser failed to bring you to Web UI, click “Tool” from Browser then select “Internet Options”.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924093434664003.jpg)

Select “Connections” tab, then click “LAN settings”.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924093434643004.jpg)

For the “Local Area Network (LAN) Settings” pop-up, uncheck the top three check-boxes. Then click “OK” to apply changes.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924093434550005.jpg)

Refresh the Web Browser to show E5377Bs-605 management console page.
